problem_text:
Is every finite simple group generated by two elements of prime-power orders m, n? (Here numbers m, n may depend on the group.) The work of many authors shows that it remains to verify this property for a small number of finite simple groups.
J. Krempa
answer: Yes, it is (mod CFSG); moreover, every finite simple group is generated by an involution and an element of prime order (C. S. H. King, J. Algebra, 478 (2017), 153–173).
